title: Add backend-stored tugboat list and display as cards on Tugboats page

requirements.text: Backend: Add a dedicated Motoko Tugboat data model and store the provided 6 tugboats in the backend canister so they can be fetched dynamically by the frontend.

quotes: add these tugboats : "tugboats": [ ... ] to tugboat page ... want it stored in the backend canister for dynamic use
these tugboats as a new dedicated Motoko data type

acceptanceCriteria: A Motoko Tugboat type exists with fields that can represent: id, name, built, bollard_pull, type.
The backend canister stores exactly the 6 user-provided tugboats (TUG-01 through TUG-06) in canister state.
The stored tugboats can be retrieved via a public query method (e.g., getAllTugboats) returning an array of Tugboat records.
Candid/TypeScript declarations generated for the backend include the Tugboat type and the new query method.

requirements.text: Frontend: Implement a React Query hook to fetch the tugboat list from the backend canister on each Tugboats page load, and wire it to the Tugboats page UI state (loading/error/empty).

quotes: dynamically fetch the tugboat list from the backend every time it loads

acceptanceCriteria: The tugboat query no longer returns a hard-coded empty array; it calls the backend actor method added in REQ-1.
The query is enabled only when the backend actor is available (consistent with existing actor-gated queries).
Loading and error states are displayed using existing QueryState components (LoadingSkeleton/ErrorState), and an empty state is shown when the list is empty.

requirements.text: Frontend (selected element only): On the Tugboats page, replace the existing content rendered inside the selected element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[1] with a card-based layout that displays the fetched tugboats (and nothing else) as individual cards.

quotes: data be displayed inside the selected element as cards, replace the element’s existing content
selected element display only these tugboat cards (replacing all existing content completely)

acceptanceCriteria: The selected content area no longer renders the current header/table/health-drawer content; it renders only tugboat cards.
Each tugboat is displayed as a Card showing at minimum: ID, Name, Built (year), Bollard pull, Type.
Cards are laid out responsively (e.g., 1 column on small screens, 2–3 columns on larger screens) with consistent spacing.
All user-facing text in this new card area is in English.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend immutable paths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Apply UI changes only to the content rendered within the selected element XPath (/html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[1]); do not redesign other pages/areas.
nonGoals: Do not implement tugboat create/edit/delete UI or any admin management flows.
Do not add third-party authentication; use existing Internet Identity integration only if needed (not required for read-only tugboat fetching).
Do not add real-time updates (WebSockets) or background subscriptions; standard React Query fetching is sufficient.
